subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4.1, running tests from and 1.6
msgSnippet: Kevin, Srikant, I was able to run JUnit 4 in Ant 1.6.5 by checking out the latest version of Ant (1.7alpha) and building it from source (takes approx 15
messageBody:
Kevin, Srikant,

I was able to run JUnit 4 in Ant 1.6.5 by checking out the latest version of Ant (1.7alpha) and building it from source (takes approx 15 minutes).

Then I copied some files to the Ant 1.6.5 folders (after backing up the originals):
etc/junit-frames.xsl
etc/junit-noframes.xsl

lib/ant-junit.jar

junit 4 or 4.1 has to be in your classpath (or in the lib/ dir), junit 3.8 not

This allows me to run junit4 tests, native mode, in my netbeans 5 installation.

Regards, Jan


----- Original Message -----
From: srikantlakhanpal
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, June 09, 2006 9:12 AM
Subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4.1, running tests from and 1.6




hi kevin
i am going through the same problem intregation proble of Ant1.6.5 version
with JUnit4.x .If u find any solution for the problem kindly share it with
me at srikant.lakhanpal@...
.
--
